pkgmetadata.longdescription:
This metapackage is used to force updates of packages that use electron-builder or electron-packager so they pick up security updates for the Chromium parts. Ebuilds that wish to update should add one of the following corresponding to the officially supported branch(es):
virtual/electron-builder:16= # alpha, corresponding to Chromium EOL, Node.js 16 outdated behind 4 minor releases (possibly vulnerable) virtual/electron-builder:15= # stable, corresponding to Chromium EOL, Node.js 16 outdated behind 8 minor releases virtual/electron-builder:14= # stable, corresponding to Chromium EOL, Node.js 14 outdated (possibly vulnerable) virtual/electron-builder:13= # stable, corresponding to Chromium EOL, Node.js 14 outdated
For unsupported, but a more secure build: virtual/electron-builder:17= # *nightly, corresponding to Chromium Beta, Node.js 16 behind two point releases virtual/electron-builder:18= # *nightly, corresponding to Chromium Dev, Node.js 16 latest
* Upstream updates everyday but this overlay plans to bump every week or on every Chromium or Node.js release.
Slots 13-16 are NOT RECOMMENDED for web based Electron apps or apps that consume assets or documents from outside the organization or personal domain and may likely contain vulnerabilities in the EOL Chromium parts.
These versions are listed in: https://www.electronjs.org/docs/tutorial/support#currently-supported-versions
If autoupdate hasn't been done at the eclass level, ebuilds may choose to manually force update to the matching slot with the corresponding Electron release using best_version and electron-app_src_compile_electron_packager or electron-app_src_compile_electron_builder calls in the electron-app.eclass.
